column2: my grandfather frequently told a story concerning a dog which he knew
column3: as an example of true fidelity. This animal was a mastiff that belonged to a friend
column5: to whom it was a constant companion. Whenever Mr. Prideaux went out for a walk
column6: Turk was sure to be near his heels. Street dogs would bark and snarl at the giant as his massive form attracted their attention
column7: but Turk seldom noticed them. At night he slept outside his master's door
column8: and no sentry could be more alert upon his watch than the faithful dog. One day Mr. Prideaux had a dinner party. The dog Turk was present
column9: and stretched his huge form upon the hearthrug. It was a cold night in winter
column10: and Mr. Prideaux's friends after dinner began to discuss the subject of dogs.
